title: How to Invest in a Roth IRA in Your 20s or 30s
subtitle: A straightforward approach to maximizing your Roth IRA for long-term financial growth.
content:
How to Invest in a Roth IRA in Your 20s or 30s

If I were in my 20s or 30s, here’s exactly how I’d invest in a Roth IRA.

1. Choose Low-Cost Index Funds

Start with low-cost index funds because I’m not smarter than the market. I might just be a lot louder on social media.

2. Focus on Total Market or S&P 500

Pick funds that track either the total market or the S&P 500. Broad, boring, beautiful.

3. Max Out Every Year

Max it out every year you can and forget about it. Seriously, forget about it! I’ll try to remind you daily from my cabin, where I intentionally don’t have good enough service to check any of this daily.

4. Consistency Over Charisma

Remember, compound interest doesn’t care how cool you are—it rewards consistency, not charisma.

Conclusion

If any of this is helpful, check out my new podcast, Your Money Guide on the Side, by clicking the link in my bio.
